properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 13 at 8:15AM CST until February 17 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville TN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Warning for the
following rivers in Middle Tennessee...Alabama...

Duck River At Columbia affecting Maury County
Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County


...Forecast Flooding Changed from Minor to Moderate Severity for the following
rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River At Centerville affecting Hickman County
. Earlier rainfall which fell overnight has led to an increase in stage levels along
the Duck River.

The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Duck River Near Hurricane Mills
* From this afternoon until Monday morning.
* At 07AM Thursday the stage was...19.5 feet
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* The river is forecast to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue
rising to near 21.0 feet Saturday morning. The river will fall below flood
stage early Monday morning.
* At 24.0 feet...Agricultural land and other areas near the river are
extensively flooded from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to
Bakerville Rd. Flood waters approach roads near the river, including Hurricane
Mills Rd, Old Hwy 13 between Cedar Grove and Forks of the River Rd, Forks of
the River Rd between Blue Creek Rd, Pumpkin Creek Rd, and near the Link Farm
State Archaeological Area, Dyer Rd, and Tumbling Creek Rd.
* At 22.0 feet...Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded
to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.
* At 20.0 feet...Agricultural land, other low lying areas, and access points
along the river from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville
Rd begin to flood. Portions of Tumbling Creek Rd east of Highway 13 begin to
flood.
* At 16.0 feet...Water begins to inundate agricultural land and other low lying
areas along the river including access points from Bucksnort to Taylortown,
Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd.
properties.instruction:
Avoid flooded areas along the river...And move personal belongings to higher
ground. Never drive through flooded roads as the depth of water may be too great
to pass...Even in trucks or sport utility vehicles. If you come across a flooded
road...Turn around don't drown.

Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio or other local media for further information
from the National Weather Service.
